docs.title: Entities
docs.text: All objects available in Grid-Adventure-V1 are shown below. Each entity is displayed in five slightly different visuals. Many other appearances exist that are similar but differ subtly from those shown.

docs.title: Floor
docs.text: Description: Floor is the basic tile of the grid. Other entities can be present on floor tiles.

docs.title: Agent
docs.text:
Description: Agent is the character that you will control and play as. It appears in the grid as a human. You will move around the grid, interact with objects and aim to complete the objective.

In 1 turn, the Agent can either move to an adjacent tile (Up/Down/Left/Right), pickup a item or use a key to unlock a door. The agent starts with some health points and you will lose if the HP drops to 0.

docs.title: Wall
docs.text:
Description:

Walls can be present on the grid and blocks the agent from moving past it.

docs.title: Exit
docs.text: Description: This is the final escape tile that the agent needs to land on to complete the objective.

docs.title: Coin
docs.text: Description: Coin is a optional item that can be picked up on the grid. The agent may collect the coin to reduce total cost by 5.

docs.title: Gem
docs.text: Description: Gem is an item on the grid that needs to be picked up. If there are any gems present, all of them need to be collected by the agent before moving to the exit tile to complete the objective.

docs.title: Key
docs.text: Description: Key is an optional item on the grid that can be picked up by the agent. A key is required to unlock a door. Any key can be used to unlock a door, but each key can only be used once.

docs.title: Door
docs.text: Description: A locked door blocks the agent from moving past it. To unlock a door, the agent first needs to collect a key. Using the key while standing adjacent to the door unlocks it and it becomes an unlocked door. The agent can freely pass through unlocked doors. Unlocked doors appear on the grid as shown below.

docs.title: Box
docs.text: Description: Box is an item on the grid that can be moved by the agent. The agent can push a box in any direction onto a free tile. Boxes cannot be pushed onto walls, doors or lava.

docs.title: Lava
docs.text: Description: Lava tiles inflict damage to the agent. When the agent lands on lava, 2 damage is dealt. The player loses if agent HP drops to 0.

docs.title: Powerups
docs.text: Powerups can also be present on the grid and can be picked up by the agent if wanted. They provide a boost and are associated with a turn or usage limit.

docs.title: Powerup-Speed
docs.text: Description: The speed powerup allows the agent to move 2 tiles in 1 turn. It has a 5 turn limit. Note that the agent can still be blocked by any objects in its way.

docs.title: Powerup-Shield
docs.text: Description: Shield protects the agent from damage taken. It has a usage limit of 5. The shield is used once every time the agent lands on lava.

docs.title: Powerup-Ghost
docs.text: Description: Ghost allows the agent to move through objects. It has a turn limit of 5. While the powerup is active, the agent can move through walls and doors. The agent does not take damage from lava as well.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Welcome to Grid-Adventure-V1.

Grid Universe is a flexible, grid‑based environment in which you implement an agent that interacts with diverse gameplay mechanics to fulfil objectives.

The world is represented as a 2D grid made up of tiles. The Agent can start at any location in the grid and needs to work towards collecting gems if any, and to move to the escape tile.

This Player Guide is designed to help you understand every part of the game:

  • Entities — the objects that you will encounter in the grid
  • Objectives — what you must accomplish to complete a level
  • Movements — how the Agent moves and interacts

Dive into each section to master the game and start gridding!

docs.title: Basic movements
docs.text:
In a turn, the agent can move to adjacent tiles (Up/Down/Left/Right)

The demo shows the agent performing basic movements.

docs.title: Collecting items
docs.text:
If the agent is on the same tile as any collectible items, the Agent can use a turn to pick it up.

The demo shows the agent picking up items such as keys, gems and coins.

docs.title: Key and Door
docs.text:
To unlock a door, the agent must first collect a key, then move to and unlock the door from an adjacent tile.

The demo shows the agent collecting the key, then unlocking the door to be able to pass through.

docs.title: Box
docs.text:
To push a box, Agent needs to stand adjacent to the Box and move in the direction to push the Box.

The demo shows the agent pushing the box aside to be able to reach the exit tile.

docs.title: Powerup-Speed
docs.text:
Speed allows the agent to move 2 tiles in 1 turn. It lasts for 5 turns.

The demo shows the agent movement once boots are picked up. Note that walls can still restrict the agent from moving 2 tiles. After 5 turns, the agent exhausts the powerup and returns to 1 tile per turn.

docs.title: Powerup-Shield
docs.text:
Shield allows the agent to move through lava without taking damage. It has 5 uses.

In this demo, the agent health has been set to 1, so landing on lava will result in a loss. Thus, the agent collects the shield powerup to pass through 3 lava tiles and reach the exit.

docs.title: Powerup-Ghost
docs.text:
Ghost powerup allows the agent to move through objects such as walls and doors. It lasts for 5 turns.

In this demo, the agent collects the ghost powerup to pass through the walls and reach the exit tile.

docs.title: Objectives
docs.text:
The objective for Grid-Adventure-V1 is to complete the following tasks:

  • If any Gems are present in the grid, collect all of them
  • Move to the Exit tile

docs.title: Optimal Solution
docs.text: An optimal solution is one that achieves all objectives with the lowest total cost.

docs.title: Cost
docs.text:
• Each turn taken by the Agent incurs a uniform cost of 3
  • Each Coin collected reduces the total cost by 5
